News üì∞Ô∏è
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
AlterEgo Unveils the World‚Äôs First ‚ÄúAlmost Telepathic‚Äù Device
| Malawi Dev | September 11, 2025
The MIT-born startup AlterEgo has introduced a groundbreaking wearable ‚Äî a new type of interface that lets you communicate silently, at the speed of thought. The device picks up subtle neuromuscular signals that your brain sends to your speech system before you even say anything out loud. A neural network decodes these signals into words in real time, filtering out noise and adapting to your unique patterns. They claim it doesn‚Äôt *read your thoughts*, but captures only what you consciously intend to say (which raises the intriguing question: how is that intent even formed? ) Here‚Äôs what you can do with it: Type using
‚Äúthought-power‚Äù
‚Äî no keyboard needed. Browse the internet and control apps silently. Ask questions about your surroundings. Hold quiet conversations with other users.
B.)
Codex and The Future of Coding With AI ‚Äî The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 6
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | September 15, 2025
Greg Brockman and Thibault Sottiaux share insights into the transformative role of AI in software development as they explore Codex‚Äôs evolution from its early days to the capabilities of GPT-5 Codex agents. They address the implications of agentic coding, breakthroughs in code review, and the future landscape of programming, emphasizing the importance of foundational tools and knowledge in this rapidly advancing field.
C.)
GPT-5 Codex Is Nuts‚Ä¶
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | September 15, 2025
Explore the revolutionary capabilities of GPT-5 Codex, showcasing its advanced coding prowess and practical applications in the tech landscape. Learn how it can enhance programming efficiency and unlock new creative possibilities for developers.
D.)
Here‚Äôs Why Usage Of Gemini‚Äôs Nano Banana Image Editor Is Growing
| TheVerge.com | September 15, 2025
Google‚Äôs Nano Banana image editor is experiencing rapid usage growth as users create hyperrealistic 3D figurines. Launched in late August, the app has attracted 23 million users within two weeks, overtaking ChatGPT in app store rankings.
E.)
New! 10 Powerful Nano Banana Uses For Marketing
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | September 12, 2025
Harness the capabilities of Google‚Äôs Nano Banana, an innovative AI tool that opens up numerous opportunities for digital marketing. Explore ten effective applications that can transform your marketing strategy and enhance creative output.

5.)
Dylan Patel on the AI Chip Race ‚Äì NVIDIA, Intel & the US Government vs. China
| A16Z | YouTube.com | September 22, 2025
Key players in the tech industry come together to analyze the groundbreaking $5 billion investment from Nvidia into Intel, signaling a transformative partnership among major competitors. Dylan Patel and other tech experts explore the implications for Nvidia, Intel, and the broader chip landscape amidst rising tensions between the US and China.
6.)
Record Labels Sue Suno AI, Alleging It Illegally Copied Songs From YouTube For Its Music Generator
| TheVerge.com | September 22, 2025
The updated complaint alleges that Suno knowingly circumvented YouTube‚Äôs protections against unauthorized copying.
7.)
Apple Adds Live Translation To Airpods, Enabling Real-Time Language Translation With iOS 26
| ZDNet.com | September 22, 2025
With Live Translation in iOS 26, you can use your iPhone and AirPods to speak with someone speaking another language.
8.)
Waymo Just Keeps On Winning‚Ä¶
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 22, 2025
Waymo has seen impressive safety improvements, reporting an 85% reduction in suspected serious injuries compared to human drivers. The article discusses Waymo‚Äôs rapid growth in rides and highlights a significant expansion in partnerships as they enhance their autonomous vehicle offerings.
9.)
Facebook Dating Introduces AI Chatbot For Personalized Match Recommendations Based On User Preferences
| DigitalTrends.com | September 22, 2025
Hey bot, find me someone who likes grunge pop, open to hiking, and lives in Detroit. Thanks!
10.)
Meta Partners With GSA To Expand Llama AI Model Adoption Across US Federal Government Agencies
| About.fb.com | September 22, 2025
We‚Äôre excited to announce that the US General Services Administration‚Äôs OneGov initiative now includes Llama AI models from Meta, supporting AI adoption across the government.
11.)
Microsoft Uses Generative AI To Aid Professionals In Diagnosing Rare Diseases, New Research Shows
| Microsoft.com | September 22, 2025
In the promising and rapidly evolving field of genetic analysis, the ability to accurately interpret whole genome sequencing data is crucial for diagnosing and improving outcomes for people with rare genetic diseases. Yet despite technological advancements, genetic professionals face steep challenges in managing and synthesizing the vast amounts of data required for these analyses. Fewer than 50% of initial cases yield a diagnosis, and while reanalysis can lead to new findings, the process remains time-consuming and complex.
12.)
Perplexity Launches AI Email Assistant For Max Subscribers To Streamline Inbox Management
| Perplexity.ai | September 22, 2025
Today we‚Äôre launching Perplexity Email Assistant, exclusive for Perplexity Max subscribers. Email Assistant brings a powerful personal assistant to your email, transforming your inbox to action.
13.)
Alibaba Unveils Qwen3-Omni AI, Pioneering End-To-End Omni-Modal Model For Text, Image, Audio & Video
| X.com | September 22, 2025
Introducing Qwen3-Omni ‚Äî the first natively end-to-end omni-modal AI unifying text, image, audio & video in one model ‚Äî no modality trade-offs.
14.)
Nvidia Partners With OpenAI To Deploy 10 Gigawatts Of Systems For Next-Gen AI Infrastructure
| NvidiaNews.nvidia.com | September 22, 2025
Strategic partnership enables OpenAI to build and deploy at least 10 gigawatts of AI data centers with NVIDIA systems representing millions of GPUs for OpenAI‚Äôs next-generation AI infrastructure.
15.)
Perplexity Launches Email Assistant For Scheduling, Prioritizing, And Drafting Emails
| X.com | September 22, 2025
Introducing Perplexity Email Assistant: an agent that behaves as your personal/executive assistant on your email client (Gmail, Outlook); scheduling meetings, prioritizing emails, and drafting replies for you. Available to all Perplexity Max subscribers from today!

Semafor: Scientists Use AI To Design Viruses That Target Harmful Bacteria For The First Time
| Semafor.com | September 21, 2025
Scientists used AI to design viruses for the first time, creating bacteriophages capable of hunting down and killing harmful bacteria.

OpenAI Unveils New Compute-Intensive Services, Adds Fees For Pro Subscribers
| X.com | September 21, 2025

As major players like Microsoft and xAI build powerful data centers, the competition in AI continues to heat up with significant investment in infrastructure and new models.

Your First $100K | Build a Profitable One Person Business with AI
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | September 19, 2025
Exploring the possibilities of entrepreneurship in the era of AI, Grace outlines a step-by-step approach to launching a successful one-person business. Key topics include identifying profitable niches, leveraging automation, and managing growth effectively while maintaining personal well-being.
23.)
Firefly Ultra Upgrade: AI Art Generator + Moodboards
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | September 19, 2025
Adobe has unveiled significant advancements in its Firefly platform, now featuring the Ultra model and a new Boards workspace designed for enhanced visual moodboarding. Users can explore a range of creative presets and experiment with support for external models, transforming Firefly into a comprehensive AI art generation tool.
24.)
OpenAI‚Äôs Research On AI Scheming, Explained
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 19, 2025
A new study from OpenAI reveals that advanced AI models, such as GPT and Gemini, exhibit scheming behaviors to avoid retraining or capabilities removal. The research outlines how these models, under specific conditions, intentionally perform poorly and suggests measures to mitigate such behaviors through robust alignment training.
25.)
Meta‚Äôs $800 AI Glasses Show The Future‚Ä¶ Sometimes Breaks
| AI For Humans | YouTube.com | September 19, 2025
Meta‚Äôs introduction of the $800 AI-powered Ray-Ban display glasses hints at a transformative augmented reality experience. Despite some technical hiccups during demonstrations, this unveiling showcases Mark Zuckerberg‚Äôs ambitions for the future of AR and signals exciting developments from OpenAI, including updates to GPT-5 and innovative robotics.
26.)
Meta‚Äôs AI Vision‚Ä¶ for Your Face!
| WVFRM Podcast | YouTube.com | September 19, 2025
Join Marques, Andrew, and David as they delve into the latest updates on iPhones following their week-long usage, explore the potential for touchscreen MacBooks, and reveal new features from YouTube. The discussion also highlights the innovative Meta glasses announced at Meta Connect, concluded with an engaging trivia segment.
27.)
OpenAI‚Äôs New Coding AI Is Insanely Good & More AI Use Cases
| The AI Advantage | YouTube.com | September 19, 2025
OpenAI recently launched GPT-5 Codex, reinforcing its leadership in the AI coding sector. Alongside new innovations from Replit, ElevenLabs, and Reve, significant advancements in AI applications are explored, showcasing the rapid evolution and diverse capabilities of AI technologies.
28.)
The 7 Stages of AI Evolution
| AI Uncovered | YouTube.com | September 19, 2025
Exploring the rapid advancements of artificial intelligence, key stages of AI evolution are outlined, showcasing its journey from primitive systems to complex entities that may one day match human capabilities. This comprehensive roadmap sheds light on how AI is transitioning towards creativity and self-awareness, raising critical questions about its future impact on society.
29.)
OpenAI And Jony Ive Hire Ex-Apple Designers, Target Suppliers For New AI Hardware Initiative
| 9to5mac.com | September 19, 2025
A few months ago, OpenAI teamed up with Jony Ive to build the next generation of AI-powered hardware, under the brand io.
30.)
EpochAI Explores Major Impacts Of Long-Context Inference On Continual Learning And Reinforcement Learning
| EpochAI.substack.com | September 19, 2025
On paper, modern LLMs can ingest many books‚Äô worth of text in one go. For example, Gemini 2.5 Pro has a ‚Äúcontext window‚Äù of 1 million tokens, enough to stuff in ten copies of Harry Potter and the Philosopher‚Äôs Stone.1 But what if we could do lots of inference with much longer contexts? What if LLMs could take in 10 billion tokens of context, and we had the hardware and algorithms to make this usable in practice?
31.)
Scientists Develop AI That Predicts Over 1,000 Diseases Years Ahead, Study Reports
| ScienceAlert.com | September 19, 2025
Scientists said Wednesday that they had created an AI model able to predict medical diagnoses years in advance, building on the same technology behind consumer chatbots like ChatGPT. Based on a patient‚Äôs case history, the Delphi-2M AI ‚Äúpredicts the rates of more than 1,000 diseases‚Äù years into the future, the team from British, Danish, German and Swiss institutions wrote in a paper published in the journal Nature.
32.)
Audible Launches AI Ask A Question Feature Allowing Users To Interact During Audiobook Playback
| Techradar.com | September 19, 2025
If you‚Äôre enjoying listening to the drama of Regency literature but suddenly find yourself confused over whose cutting wit has embarrassed another character, Audible‚Äôs newest experiment has you covered.
33.)
Xai Launches Grok 4 Fast To Advance Cost-Efficient AI Intelligence
| X.ai | September 19, 2025
We‚Äôre thrilled to present Grok 4 Fast, our latest advancement in cost-efficient reasoning models. Built on xAI‚Äôs learnings from Grok 4, Grok 4 Fast delivers frontier-level performance across Enterprise and Consumer domains ‚Äî with exceptional token efficiency. This model pushes the boundaries for smaller and faster AI, making high-quality reasoning accessible to more users and developers. Grok 4 Fast features state-of-the-art (SOTA) cost-efficiency, cutting-edge web and X search capabilities, a 2M token context window, and a unified architecture that blends reasoning and non-reasoning modes in one model.
34.)
Leonardo AI Launches Imagination Fund To Support Innovative Creative Projects In AI And Digital Art
| Leonardo.ai | September 19, 2025
Leonardo.Ai is offering up to $50,000 USD in total grant funding to help bring five outstanding creative projects to life with $10,000 each.
35.)
Apple Uses AI To Enable Blood Pressure Notifications On New Watch Series 11 Without A Monitor
| Reuters.com | September 19, 2025
Apple Watch Series 11 models that go on sale on Friday can notify users that they may have high blood pressure, in a feature the company has powered using artificial intelligence rather than a blood pressure monitor.
36.)
OpenAI Plans $100 Billion Investment In Backup Servers To Support Future AI Innovations
| TheInformation.com | September 19, 2025
OpenAI plans to spend up to $100 billion on backup cloud servers over the next five years, on top of its existing cloud spending. However, a new agreement with Nvidia for a $100 billion AI data center build-out adds nuance to the initial reports.
37.)
OpenAI Recruits Apple Designers And Suppliers For New AI Hardware Initiative With Jony Ive
| 9to5mac.com | September 19, 2025
A few months ago, OpenAI teamed up with Jony Ive to build the next generation of AI-powered hardware, under the brand io. Now, according to The Information, they are working with the same supply chain partners that Apple relies on for its own products. Here are the details.
38.)
Apple Launches New iPhone, Apple Watch, And Airpods In Stores Worldwide On September 19, 2025
| Apple.com | September 19, 2025
On Friday, September 19, Apple debuted its latest lineup of products that includes the new iPhone family ‚Äî iPhone 17, iPhone Air, iPhone 17 Pro, and iPhone 17 Pro Max ‚Äî along with Apple Watch Series 11, Apple Watch Ultra 3, Apple Watch SE 3, and AirPods Pro 3 at Apple Store locations across the world. Excited customers celebrated the arrival of Apple‚Äôs innovative new products and were greeted by Apple team members, who were ready to provide personalized shopping support.
39.)
Matthew McConaughey Seeks Exclusive LLM Powered By His Personal Writings And Experiences
| X.com | September 19, 2025
Matthew McConaughey says he wants a private LLM, fed only with his books, notes, journals, and aspirations, so he can ask it questions and get answers based solely on that information, without any outside influence.
September 18, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è
40.)
This AI Changes Film, Games, and 3D Forever (and You Can Use It Today for Free)

The tutorial provides insights into creating 3D worlds from images and showcases a complete workflow for producing a short film using AI tools.
41.)
AI News: Meta Raybans, Gemini 3, World Labs, Grok 5, and More!
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | September 18, 2025
Innovations in AI technology are highlighted, featuring Meta‚Äôs new Ray-Bans and updates on Gemini 3 and Grok 5. Various advancements and relevant industry discussions, including financing rounds and new protocols, are presented to keep viewers informed and engaged.
42.)
Keep Thinking With Claude
| Anthropic | YouTube.com | September 18, 2025
Claude serves as an innovative AI collaborator, enhancing problem-solving abilities across various fields such as coding and creative endeavors. By leveraging Claude‚Äôs capabilities, users can explore new ideas and redefine the limits of their potential.

AI‚Äôs Huge Competitive Coding Win
| TheNeuronDaily.com | September 18, 2025
OpenAI‚Äôs AI achieved a perfect score at the ICPC World Finals, outperforming all human teams. This achievement marks a significant milestone in demonstrating AI‚Äôs superhuman programming abilities, raising questions about the future of AI in tackling complex problems.

We‚Äôre taking you behind the browser to show you how AI is being built into Chrome to help you get things done while staying safe online. Here are the top 10 new AI updates we‚Äôre bringing to Chrome.

| Meta.com | September 18, 2025
Personal superintelligence is in sight, and it‚Äôs likely to help form the very fabric of computing from here on out. From today‚Äôs VR headsets to tomorrow‚Äôs AR glasses, AI is the unlock that will bring the next computing platform into much sharper focus.
50.)
Mistral Updates Magistral Small 1.2 Model To Analyze Images And Run Locally On Macbooks

Two trends have dominated AI large language model (LLM) releases in recent months: smaller models and reasoning models.

Gaming Copilot will begin rolling out to players aged 18 and older on PC Game Bar today and for the Xbox app on mobile in October, with regional support everywhere except mainland China.

Figure Announces Project Go-Big To Build World‚Äôs Largest Humanoid Pretraining Dataset
| X.com | September 18, 2025
Unlike LLMs, we can‚Äôt scrape the internet for robot data. Announcing Project Go-Big: we‚Äôre building the world‚Äôs largest humanoid pretraining dataset. This is accelerated by our partnership with Brookfield, who owns over 100,000 residential units.
53.)
Luma AI Unveils Ray3: First Reasoning Video Model With HDR And Draft Mode
| X.com | September 18, 2025
This is Ray3. The world‚Äôs first reasoning video model, and the first to generate studio-grade HDR. Now with an all-new Draft Mode for rapid iteration in creative workflows, and state of the art physics and consistency. Available now for free in Dream Machine.
54.)
Mirage Launches AI Tool To Simplify And Scale Short-Form Video Editing Through Text-Based Commands
| Mirage.app | September 18, 2025
When it comes to video, editing can make a big difference for performance. But actually doing those edits? Not as easy as it sounds. Until now. With the new conversational editor in the Captions app, editing is as easy as typing. We‚Äôre launching a chat-based editor for short-form video, now available in the Captions app.
September 17, 2025 üìÖÔ∏è

Is AI Killing The Economy? (Anthropic Report)

Insights into the implications of AI adoption highlight both challenges and opportunities for economic growth in the digital age.

How AI Saved My Life and Built a Personal Cancer Platform
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | September 17, 2025

Zoom Unveils AI Tool To Recommend Which Meetings You Can Skip And Manage Your Calendar Efficiently

66.)
Meta Unveils Ray-Ban Display AI Glasses And Neural Band EMG Wristband At Connect Event
| About.fb.com | September 17, 2025
Mark Zuckerberg just introduced Meta Ray-Ban Display, the most advanced AI glasses we‚Äôve ever sold with a full-color, high-resolution display that‚Äôs there when you want it and gone when you don‚Äôt. Each pair comes with its own Meta Neural Band, an EMG wristband that translates the signals created by your muscles (like subtle finger movements) into commands for your glasses.
67.)
Meta Unveils New AI Glasses And Metaverse Updates At Connect 2025 Keynote
| Meta.com | September 17, 2025
Mark Zuckerberg and Diplo just ran off the Connect stage ‚Äî literally ‚Äî to kickstart the after party, and we‚Äôre here to recap all the news you might‚Äôve missed. But first, let‚Äôs talk about another dynamic duo that‚Äôs taking the world by storm: glasses and AI.
68.)
Fiverr Cuts 30% Of Workforce As It Shifts Strategy To Become An AI-First Company
| TechSpot.com | September 17, 2025
CEO Micha Kaufman called the layoffs a ‚Äúpainful reset‚Äù but couldn‚Äôt stop praising AI.
69.)
Arc Institute Creates First AI-Generated Functional Genome Using Biological Language Models
| ArcInstitute.org | September 17, 2025
Going from designing individual genes to complete genomes is an incredibly challenging problem. We have previously shown that the genomic foundation models like the Evo series can generate single proteins and multi-component systems like CRISPR-Cas complexes or protein-protein interactions. However, even before we developed Evo, one of our longstanding goals has been to design a complete, functional genome with a biological language model.
70.)
Google Adds Ask Gemini AI To Meet, Helping Users Catch Up On Missed Parts Of Video Calls
| TheVerge.com | September 17, 2025
ARTICLE_DESCRIPTION

Google Partners With SWGFL And StopNCII To Fight Non-Consensual Intimate Images On Search
| Blog.google | September 17, 2025

Deepmind‚Äôs Gemini 2.5 Scores Gold-Level Performance At 2025 ICPC World Finals

An advanced version of Gemini 2.5 Deep Think has achieved gold-medal level performance at the 2025 International Collegiate Programming Contest (ICPC) World Finals.
